I'm sure only few of Europeans take interest in events that happen in the boundaries of our old kind Europe now. Let's take a dramatic example of winning democracy in neighbouring Georgia. Our press makes us to sell the idea that this backward country has turned out to be the main bastion of liberty and democracy in the region, related directly to Europe both now and always. But Georgian midterm parliamentary election has become apotheosis of frame-up. It has clearly shown us that violation of human rights and freedoms as well as persecution on political grounds turned into ordinary things in present-day "democratic Georgia". Moreover, at last Georgian President, who in increasing frequency demonstrates his machismo, has reached his main goal - in any case weak opposition has lost its last chance to effect the internal situation in the country. And again Europe keeps silence! Neither of our newspapers nor one of our politicians even skated over this crushing defeat of opposition in such young democratic state as Georgia. Did nobody among our European leaders and rights advocates notice anything? Or, maybe, EU leadership always waits direct recommendations of Washington and active participation of Soros' Fund in affairs of countries, bordering Europe...

post_info.post_title: I'm sure only few of Europeans take interest in events that happen in the boundaries
